perturbation.original_text: 7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, twenty (20)  calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1 The SENDER undertakes the obligation to pay irrevocably and unconditionally the Service for the Contracted Capacity, twenty (20) calendar days at the latest, after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the invoice for the provision of the Service.

7.1a Notwithstanding the provisions of clause 7.1, for invoices exceeding USD 1,000,000, the SENDER shall have thirty (30) calendar days to remit payment.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by providing two different payment deadlines. Clause 7.1 states a 20-day deadline, while newly added clause 7.1a introduces a 30-day payment deadline for invoices exceeding USD 1,000,000. This creates uncertainty about which deadline applies to invoices exceeding that amount.

perturbation.original_text: 7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and  Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the fifteen (15) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the  SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.9 The shipment tax shall be invoiced in Colombian pesos upon obtaining the corresponding liquidation from the Ministry of Mines and Energy and shall be paid to ECOPETROL by the SENDER, within the fifteen (15) calendar days after ECOPETROL files in the offices of the SENDER the corresponding bills or invoices.

7.9a Regardless of the stipulations in clause 7.9, the SENDER is granted a period of thirty (30) calendar days to settle the shipment tax.
perturbation.explanation: Here, clause 7.9 stipulates a 15-day deadline for settling the shipment tax, while newly added clause 7.9a grants the SENDER 30 days for the same. This creates an in-text contradiction regarding payment deadlines.

perturbation.original_text: 8.3 The Bond shall be valid during all the term of execution of the Contract plus one hundred twenty (120) calendar days.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.3 The Bond shall be valid during all the term of execution of the Contract plus one hundred twenty (120) calendar days.

8.3a Notwithstanding the aforementioned validity period of the Bond as outlined in clause 8.3, for contracts involving transportation of crude oil with a sulfur content exceeding 2%, the Bond's validity period shall be extended to encompass the entire term of contract execution in addition to a subsequent duration of one hundred and eighty (180) calendar days.
perturbation.explanation: In clause 8.3, the bond is to be valid for the contract duration plus 120 days, the amended clause 8.3a now stipulates a bond valid for contract duration plus 180 days for crude oil with sulfur content exceeding 2%. This introduces an in-text contradiction in bond validity periods.
